statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -7 \\ -8 \\ -4 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 5 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 20 \\ -3 \\ -4 \\ 14 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -7 \\ -8 \\ -4 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 5 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 20 \\ -3 \\ -4 \\ 14 \end{array}\right].
